17 7 19 19 7 20 5 21 21 5 23 23 this vest has a positive ease of 10-15cm /4-6 **materials** 3 3 4 4 5 5 6 6 6 skeins of highland wool color 02 3 3 3 3 4 4 4 5 5 skeins of friends kid silk color 20 3 3 3 3 4 4 4 5 5 skeins of friends kid silk color 09 **needles** circular needle 4 5 mm 60-80 cm /us 7 24-31 5 for body circular needle 4 mm 60-80 cm /us 6 24-31 5 for bottom edge circular needle 3 75 mm 40 cm /us 5 16 for neckline and armhole edges **yarn quality** highland wool hobbii 100% peruvian highland wool 50 g / 1 8 oz = 175 m / 191 yds friends kid silk hobbii 72% mohair 25% silk 3% wool 25 g / 0 9 oz = 200 m / 218 yds **gauge** 21 sts x 27 row = 10 cm x 10 cm / 4 x 4 in stockinette stitch on 4 5 mm/ us 7 needles after blocking note one strand of each yarn is held together at all times **pattern information** the terra vest is worked from the top down using a saddle shoulder construction two rectangles are created first from which stitches are picked up for the back and fronts the back is worked flat with short row to shape the shoulders then increases are added for the armholes the fronts are shaped with short row and increases for the v neck once the body is joined at the underarms it s worked in the round to the bottom edge armhole and neckline ribbing are worked in 1x1 rib with central double decreases at the v neck for a neater look techniques include long tail cast-on placing sts on hold picking up stitches german short row backward loop cast-on increases working flat and in the round italian bind-off 1x1 ribbing and central double decreases find the
